BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: The Bronx Museum of the Arts

IRS990.Desc: All of the Museums exhibitions were accompanied by gallery tours, artist talks, performances, and film and video screenings, as well as other ongoing programs and community partnerships including Boogie on the Boulevard; Lunar New Year Celebration; storytelling competitions hosted by The Moth, PEN World Voices Festival, tours of the Grand Concourse; Bronx Museum Holiday Market; Senior Luncheons; and artist programming collaborations. During fiscal year 2018, the Museum presented the following exhibitions: Angel Otero: Elegies; Gordon Matta-Clark: Anarchitect; Susannah Ray: A Further Shore; Oded Halahmy: Exile is Home; Diana Al-Hadid: Delirious Matter; Randy H. Goodman, Iran: Women Only; Manuel Mendive: Nature, Spirit, and Body; Eddie Martinez: White Outs; Rochelle Feinstein: Image of an Image; Chris Ho: Aloha to the World at the Don Ho Terrace.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Ongoing education programs included the Group Visits Program; Family Affair; Teen Summer Program; School Partnerships with PS 73 and IS 218; and After-School Programs such as Teen Council, the CASA program with PS 73, and Teen Thursdays. Through the city-wide Art a Catalyst for Change anti-gun violence initiative, four after-school programs continued with local public schools: I.S. 218, MS 301, MS 22, and School for Excellence High School.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: NYS Capital Funding Consultant: The Wright Group was engaged in FY18 to assist with fundraising for the proposed renovation of the South Wing

THE MUSEUM COLLECTS AND MAINTAINS A PERMANENT COLLECTION OF 20TH AND 21ST CENTURY ARTWORKS BY ARTISTS OF AFRICAN, ASIAN AND LATIN AMERICAN DESCENT, AS WELL AS BY ARTISTS FOR WHOM THE BRONX HAS BEEN CRITICAL TO THEIR ARTISTIC PRACTICE AND DEVELOPMENT. THE MUSEUMS REGISTRAR MAINTAINS AN INVENTORY OF THE PERMANENT COLLECTION. THE COLLECTION IS INSURED FOR $6 MILLION, PLUS AN ADDITIONAL $6 MILLION FOR ITEMS IN TRANSIT OR ON LOAN AT OTHER LOCATIONS. THE VALUE OF THE COLLECTION, WHICH WAS ACQUIRED THROUGH PURCHASES AND CONTRIBUTIONS SINCE THE MUSEUMS INCEPTION, IS NOT REFLECTED AS AN ASSET ON THE STATEMENT OF FINANCIAL POSITION. PURCHASES OF COLLECTION ITEMS ARE EXPENSED IN THE YEAR OF ACQUISITION. CONTRIBUTIONS OF COLLECTION ITEMS ARE NOT RECOGNIZED IN THE STATEMENT OF ACTIVITIES. DONATED ARTWORK(S) SOLD AT THE MUSEUMS ANNUAL BENEFIT ART AUCTION ARE RECORDED AS ANNUAL GALA BENEFIT RECEIPTS AT THE AUCTION SALES PRICE(S).
TO FUND THE HOLLY BLOCK CURATORSHIP FOR ART & SOCIAL JUSTICE
RENTAL EXPENSES $73,754
Rental Expenses $73,754

Holly Block, the executive director, passed away on October 6, 2017. Klaudio Rodriguez was appointed Deputy Director on September 11, 2017. The Deputy Director and other senior Executives of the Museum and a special Board subcommittee managed the Museum in 2017 while a search was undertaken for the Executive Director position. In FY 2019 Deborah Cullen-Morales was hired as the Executive director.
THE ORGANIZATION IS REPORTING THE NUMBER OF ITEMS RECEIVED

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, DEPUTY DIRECTOR AND THE CFO REVIEW A FINAL DRAFT 990 PREPARED BY THE MUSEUMS AUDITOR. THIS DRAFT IS THEN SUBMITTED TO THE Audit COMMITTEE FOR DETAILED REVIEW AND APPROVAL. FOLLOWING APPROVAL, IT IS THEN CIRCULATED TO THE FULL BOARD OF TRUSTEES PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A DISCLOSURE STATEMENT IS REQUIRED TO BE COMPLETED ANNUALLY BY ALL TRUSTEES. IF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES DETERMINES THAT AN ACTUAL OR POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST WAS NOT DISCLOSED, CORRECTIVE ACTION IS TAKEN. THERE WERE NO INSTANCES OF CONFLICT OF INTEREST MANAGEMENT IN THE MUSEUM during FY 18.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MUSEUM'S CURRENT EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR WAS APPOINTED ON JULY 9, 2018, FOLLOWING THE DEATH OF THE MUSEUM'S LONG SERVING EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR, HOLLY BLOCK, ON OCTOBER 6, 2017.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: COMPENSATION WAS BASED ON A 2017 AAMD (ASSOCIATION OF ART MUSEUM DIRECTORS) SALARY SURVEY AND OTHER INDUSTRY SALARY COMPILATIONS FROM CONSULTANTS. It was then REVIEWED BY THE BOARD EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART I, LINE 1, DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION MISSION:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BRONX MUSEUM OF THE ARTS (THE "MUSEUM") IS A CONTEMPORARY ART MUSEUM THAT CONNECTS DIVERSE AUDIENCES TO THE URBAN EXPERIENCE THROUGH ITS PERMANENT COLLECTION, SPECIAL EXHIBITIONS, EDUCATION PROGRAMS, AND PUBLIC AND COMMUNITY PROGRAMMING AND OUTREACH ACTIVITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART III, LINE 1, DESCRIPTION OF ORGANIZATION MISSION:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BRONX MUSEUM OF THE ARTS IS A CONTEMPORARY ART MUSEUM THAT CONNECTS DIVERSE AUDIENCES TO THE URBAN EXPERIENCE THROUGH ITS PERMANENT COLLECTION, SPECIAL EXHIBITIONS, EDUCATION PROGRAMS, AND PUBLIC AND COMMUNITY PROGRAMMING AND OUTREACH ACTIVITIES. REFLECTING THE BOROUGHS DYNAMIC COMMUNITIES, THE MUSEUM IS THE CROSSROAD WHERE ARTISTS, LOCAL RESIDENTS, NATIONAL AND INTERNATIONAL VISITORS MEET IN THE BRONX.
